http://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/

Source: Kerbin 70x70km -> Moho 20x??km..

Compare with

Kerbin70x70km->Eve (90x??km)->Moho 20x??km..

Question:-

1) Why going to Eve slingshot...does not save delta-v. (Base on alexmoon calculation). But in real game environment...I did save about 500 delta-v?

I can't said that 500 is perfectly measured....Cause I just launch, and reload and launch again.

Edited December 23, 2013 by Sirine
The planner assumes circular orbits. If you manage to plan an unassisted flyby of Eve, then to Moho without burning, you will earn a massive load of Delta V.

Source: Kerbin 70x70km -> Moho 20x??km..

Compare with

Kerbin70x70km->Eve (90x??km)->Moho 20x??km..

Kerbin -> Eve -> Moho is planned using four to six maneuvers by the planner:

1/ Kerbin ejection

2/ (inclination fix)

3/ Eve injection

4/ Eve ejection

5/ (inclination fix)

6/ Moho injection

But in reality you're not going to do all these maneuvers. You're going to do this:

1/ Kerbin ejection

2/ (inclination fix)

3/ Eve slingshot = injection - ejection + inclination fix to Moho (those "-" an "+" are figurative)

4/ (corrections)

5/ Moho injection

This maneuver could theoretically be calculated and optimized, but the planner just doesn't provide that
